context: If people perform in school talent shows often, then they attend and are very engaged with school events. People either perform in school talent shows often or are inactive and disinterested members of their community. If people chaperone high school dances, then they are not students who attend the school. All people who are inactive and disinterested members of their community chaperone high school dances. All young children and teenagers who wish to further their academic careers and educational opportunities are students who attend the school. Bonnie either both attends and is very engaged with school events and is a student who attends the school, or she neither attends and is very engaged with school events nor is a student who attends the school.
question: Based on the above information, is the following statement true, false, or uncertain? If Bonnie is either both a young child or teenager who wishes to further her academic career and educational opportunities and chaperones high school dances or neither is a young child nor teenager who wishes to further her academic career and educational opportunities, then Bonnie is either a student who attends the school or is an inactive and disinterested member of the community.
raw_logic_programs:
Predicates:
AttendAndEngaged(x) ::: x attends and is very engaged with school events.
InactiveDisinterested(x) ::: x is inactive and disinterested members of their community.
PerformTalentShowsOften(x) ::: x performs in school talent shows often.
ChaperoneHighSchoolDances(x) ::: x chaperones high school dances.
StudentWhoAttendsSchool(x) ::: x is a student who attends the school.
YoungChildrenAndTeenagersWishFurtherEducation(x) ::: x are young children and teenagers who wish to further their academic careers and educational opportunities.

Premises:
∀x (PerformTalentShowsOften(x) → AttendAndEngaged(x)) ::: If people perform in school talent shows often, then they attend and are very engaged with school events.
∀x (PerformTalentShowsOften(x) ⊕ InactiveDisinterested(x)) ::: People either perform in school talent shows often or are inactive and disinterested members of their community.
¬(ChaperoneHighSchoolDances(x) ∧ StudentWhoAttendsSchool(x)) ::: If people chaperone high school dances, then they are not students who attend the school.
∀x (InactiveDisinterested(x) → ChaperoneHighSchoolDances(x)) ::: All people who are inactive and disinterested members of their community chaperone high school dances.
∀x (YoungChildrenAndTeenagersWishFurtherEducation(x) → StudentWhoAttendsSchool(x)) ::: All young children and teenagers who wish to further their academic careers and educational opportunities are students who attend the school.
(AttendAndEngaged(bonnie) ∧ StudentWhoAttendsSchool(bonnie)) ⊕ ¬(AttendAndEngaged(bonnie) ∨ StudentWhoAttendsSchool(bonnie)) ::: Bonnie either both attends and is very engaged with school events and is a student who attends the school, or she neither attends and is very engaged with school events nor is a student who attends the school.

Conclusion:
((YoungChildrenAndTeenagersWishFurtherEducation(bonnie) ∧ ChaperoneHighSchoolDances(bonnie)) ⊕ ¬(YoungChildrenAndTeenagersWishFurtherEducation(bonnie) ∨ ChaperoneHighSchoolDances(bonnie))) → (StudentWhoAttendsSchool(bonnie) ∨ InactiveDisinterested(bonnie))) ::: If Bonnie is either both a young child or teenager who wishes to further her academic career and educational opportunities and chaperones high school dances or neither is a young child nor teenager who wishes to further her academic career and educational opportunities, then Bonnie is either a student who attends the school or is an inactive and disinterested member of the community.
